title: `Command::status` method doesn't say when it will return an `Err(...)`

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-docs
labels.description: Area: documentation for any part of the project, including the compiler, standard library, and tools

body:
### Location

rustdocs for std

### Summary

I think the following methods:

[Command::spawn(&mut self)](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/process/struct.Command.html#method.spawn)
[Command::output(&mut self)](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/process/struct.Command.html#method.output)
[Command::status(&mut self)](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/process/struct.Command.html#method.status)
[Child::wait(&mut self)](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/process/struct.Child.html#method.wait)
[Child::try_wait(&mut self)](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/process/struct.Child.html#method.try_wait)
[Child::wait_with_output(self)](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/process/struct.Child.html#method.wait_with_output)

ought to mention when they will exit with an `Err(_)`. From a discussion in the community Discord:

"nils, supposedly one of the many: they will error when the command is not found
nils, supposedly one of the many: well
nils, supposedly one of the many: there are probably other conditions than "command not found"
nils, supposedly one of the many: just in general when it failed to spawn it
nils, supposedly one of the many: which can happen for all kinds of issues"

Maybe it should be a module level doc to avoid duplication.
